About meIndependent researcher of a variety of obscure topics. Fascinated by textile arts, material culture, social history & cutting edge technology. Daylighting as a mid-level corporate sarariwoman to support my book habit.

In the SCA, I am known as Lady Alisandre de la Chapelle from the Barony of South Downs in the Kingdom of Meridies.

About my libraryI am always finding new rabbit holes to fall into, so it is eclectic and constantly expanding.

Lauren Hawkeye


Lauren Hawkeye is a writer, theatre enthusiast, knitting aficionado and animal lover
who lives in the shadows of the great Rocky Mountains of Alberta, Canada. She’s
older than she looks—really—and younger than she feels—most of the time—and she
loves to explore the journeys that take women through life in her stories.

Where to find Lauren Hawkeye online

Where to buy in print


Safe Haven (Special Edition New Adult Romance-- All Proceeds go to Brenda Novak's Online Auction for Diabetes Research)
Price: $2.99 USD. Words: 58,070. Language: English. Published: May 1, 2015 by Brenda Novak. Categories: Fiction » Romance » New adult, Fiction » Romance » Contemporary
Don’t forget to check out SWEET TALK, SWEET DREAMS and SWEET SEDUCTION, three limited edition collections from Brenda Novak’s Online Auction for Diabetes Research, as well as LOVE THAT!, Brenda Novak's new cookbook with Jan Coad... read and help the fight against
Master of the Island (Invitation to Eden FREE prequel!)
Price: Free! Words: 13,110. Language: English. Published: March 25, 2014. Categories: Fiction » Romance » Contemporary, Fiction » Romance » Short stories
(4.75 from 4 reviews)
When his life takes a dark turn, billionaire Theodosius Vardalos purchases a deserted island in the Bermuda triangle- the better, he thinks, to hide his scars from the rest of the world. What Theo doesn’t know is that the island can give him hope… hope of future happiness, despite the horrible scars that make him a recluse. Hope to be had in the arms of a mysterious blonde he hasn’t yet met…

Lauren Hawkeye's tag cloud

Gabriella Dede Okai-Addey began writing short stories since she was about 6 years old. Her first short story was titled, A Lifetime. She aspires to be an engineer, or an author should she excel as a writer. She likes to sing, dance, play piano, draw, play basketball and make crafts. She lives in Laurel, Maryland with her dad, mom and her little sister.

Rachel DeWoskin

Rachel DeWoskin is the author of six books of fiction and nonfiction for teens and adults: Foreign Babes in Beijing: Behind the Scenes of a New China, Repeat After Me, Big Girl Small (winner of ALA’s Alex Award), Blind, Someday We Will Fly (winner of the National Jewish Book Award and ALA’s Sydney Taylor Book Award), and Banshee. She is also an accomplished poet, and her debut collection Two Menus was released in 2020 from University of Chicago Press. Her essays and articles have appeared in The New Yorker, Vanity Fair, The Sunday Times Magazine of London, Teachers and Writers, and numerous anthologies. She spent her twenties in China as the unlikely star of a nighttime soap opera, which became the basis for her memoir. She is on the core fiction faculty at the University of Chicago, and is an affiliated faculty member of the Centers for East Asian Studies and Jewish Studies. She lives in Chicago with her husband and two daughters.


Jill Grinberg

What is JacketFlap

  • JacketFlap connects you to the work of more than 200,000 authors, illustrators, publishers and other creators of books for Children and Young Adults. The site is updated daily with information about every book, author, illustrator, and publisher in the children's / young adult book industry. Members include published authors and illustrators, librarians, agents, editors, publicists, booksellers, publishers and fans.

My love of books and the ‘written’ word started in my childhood, now in my early 50’s it is still an important part of my life. Books have got me through some difficult times over the years and I am keen to share some of the great books and authors past and present.

For some time it has been plan to start a book review service now after a ‘trying’ and sometimes a painful birth I decided to take the plunger in November 2014 I have Set up the blog and the Social Media accounts.  I am guessing as you are reading this you are as lover of the written word. Welcome to ‘The Last Word – Book Review’ and thank you for taking the time to view my blog. This is just the first step in what I hope will become something bigger and exciting as time goes on. 2015 holds some exciting ideas. I have past experience in broadcasting and this is something that I hope to bring together in 2015.

There is something quite special about visiting your local book store and picking up a new book is it the smell of a newly printed book that gets you first..?

I am also available for any media related book reviews that you may require. Please feel free to contact me for further information. 

The Last Word – Book Review can be contacted via the ‘Contact’ page. I would be good to hear from you.

Thank you and happy reading.


Last Word – Book Review.

  1. Hi John, just happened upon your blog today. You have reviewed an impressive range of books! Will be following you for the next words.

Hi, I'm also Taxman, an administrator on the English Wikipedia. I'm impressed by Wiktionary so far and the potential that truly multilingual dictionaries represent. I'm learning Hindi and I've found it very useful in my learning to use the reference sources I have to create and correct entries here. I hope to add entries for all the Hindi words in my vocabulary list.

About me

When I was growing up in 70s Britain, I was infected by Blakes’ 7, 2000AD, Traveller RPG, and Doctor Who. After 20 years spent trying to live a regular life working in the software industry, where I met my wife and did normal stuff, I finally succumbed to science fiction-itis in 2011, and now earn my living writing science fiction novels.

I’ve also very proud to have published other authors through imprints: Greyhart Press, The Repository of Imagination, and Human Legion Publications.

Last time I counted (early 2019) I’d sold just shy of 250,000 books since 2011.

My most popular books are set in the Human Legion Universe of military SF/ space opera or the mech mayhem of the Four Horsemen Universe, created by Mark H Wandrey and Chris Kennedy. If you click or tap on the image, you can join the Legion and get free books. Or you can find out more at humanlegion.com
